channel.title: CVE Feed for ITPison -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ITPison -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-28700|2023-06-02T00:00:00 -- itpison -- omicard%20edm
item.description: OMICARD EDM backend system’s file uploading function does not restrict upload of file with dangerous type. A local area network attacker with administrator privileges can exploit this vulnerability to upload and run arbitrary executable files to perform arbitrary system commands or disrupt service.

item.title: CVE-2023-48371|2023-12-15T04:11:24.574Z -- itpison -- omicard%20edm%20%27s%20sms
item.description: ITPison OMICARD EDM’s file uploading function does not restrict upload of file with dangerous type. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to upload and run arbitrary executable files to perform arbitrary system commands or disrupt service.

item.title: CVE-2023-48372|2023-12-15T04:18:31.142Z -- itpison -- omicard%20edm%20%27s%20sms
item.description: ITPison OMICARD EDM 's SMS-related function has insufficient validation for user input. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary SQL commands to access, modify and delete database.

item.title: CVE-2023-48373|2023-12-15T04:27:54.223Z -- itpison -- omicard%20edm%20%27s%20sms
item.description: ITPison OMICARD EDM has a path traversal vulnerability within its parameter “FileName” in a specific function. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to bypass authentication and download arbitrary system files.

item.title: CVE-2023-32753|2023-06-16T00:00:00 -- itpison -- contact%20itpison
item.description: OMICARD EDM’s file uploading function does not restrict upload of file with dangerous type. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to upload and run arbitrary executable files to perform arbitrary system commands or disrupt service.

item.title: CVE-2024-4894|2024-06-11T20:23:58.948Z -- itpison -- omicard%20edm
item.description: ITPison OMICARD EDM fails to properly filter specific URL parameter, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to modify the parameters and conduct Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attacks. This vulnerability enables attackers to probe internal network information.
